meanings.definition: laurelling (verb): to crown with laurel as a mark of honor or victory
meanings.sent1: After winning the race, the champion was laurelling with a wreath of laurel leaves.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tradition of laurelling the victors continues to this day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel laurelled itself with a tiny crown made of leaves, pretending to be a royal squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun was laurelling the mountain peaks with a golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was laurelling the top student with praise and recognition.

meanings.definition: laurelling (noun): the act of crowning with laurel
meanings.sent1: The laurelling of the hero was a moment of great celebration.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, the laurelling was a symbol of great achievement.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's laurelling with a flower crown brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The laurelling of the statue made it stand out among the rest in the park.
meanings.sent5: The annual laurelling ceremony honored the bravest warriors in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: laurelling (adjective): pertaining to the act of crowning with laurel
meanings.sent1: The laurelling ceremony was a grand event attended by all.
meanings.sent2: The laurelling tradition dates back centuries in our culture.
meanings.sent3: The laurelling decorations added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: The laurelling wreath symbolized victory and honor.
meanings.sent5: The laurelling crown shone brightly under the spotlight.
